name: SecureDrop ID - Delivery Authorization System
description: A Proof-of-Concept (PoC) for a secure delivery system that ensures double verification at the time of package handover using QR codes, OTP, and NFC (future scope). It empowers customers to authorize deliveries while helping brands reduce fraud and unauthorized access.
roadmap: Add anomaly detection with AI/ML for unusual delivery patterns
Provide blockchain-based tamper-proof delivery audit logs
Develop native mobile apps for delivery agents and customers
Enhance SDK with plug-and-play integrations for major e-commerce platforms

eventImages.title: High-Level Architecture
eventImages.description: System design of SecureDrop with B2B SDK, B2C App, and verification services.

features: Unique SecureDropID + QR code tagging for every package
Customer-controlled delivery approval via B2C app
B2B SDK for easy integration with e-commerce platforms

B2B_SDK: Verification hooks to check delivery authorization status
B2C_App: Delivery dashboard to manage upcoming deliveries
OTP, QR, and future NFC-based authorization
History of past deliveries with verification logs

key_learnings: Building B2B SDKs for third-party platform integration
Architecting microservices for QR and OTP verification
Balancing user experience with strong security protocols
Understanding logistics workflows and failure points

story.origin: SecureDrop started as an idea to solve the growing issue of package theft and delivery fraud. I wanted to design a system that could give customers more control over their deliveries.
story.journey: The project began with high-level diagrams and workflows, evolving into a Proof-of-Concept with QR and OTP-based authorization. I built it as a multi-component system with a landing page, a B2C app, a B2B SDK, and optional admin tools.
story.growth: With each iteration, I explored how brands could seamlessly integrate SecureDrop into their backends, while customers could enjoy peace of mind knowing deliveries required explicit authorization.
story.current: SecureDrop is currently an ongoing PoC, with planned expansions into NFC-based verification, AI anomaly detection, and blockchain-backed audit logs.
